name: Program Development
description: Creating and planning curriculum, pedagogy, instruction, and delivery methods for guiding student learning.

name: Curriculum / Course Planning and Design
description: Planning learning activities, selecting and creating course content and materials, engaging in course organization

name: Teaching
description: Delivering course content, managing and monitoring student assignments and classroom (physical or virtual) activities.

name: Tutoring
description: Formally providing supplemental academic assistance in support of regular coursework.

name: Advising
description: Assisting students with activities related to their educational experience including scheduling, academic support, planning and selecting curricular pathways and career development.

name: Academic Service
description: Serving on committees or task forces to support teaching and learning.

name: Assessment and Grading
description: Assessing prior and current learning; developing and selecting assessment methodologies; evaluating student assignments and performance to award course credit and contribute to broader assessment of student learning outcomes.

name: Admissions
description: Guiding potential students through the collection, verification, and evaluation of credentials in the application process.

name: Advising
description: Assisting students with activities related to their educational experience including scheduling, academic support, planning and selecting curricular pathways and career development.

name: Counseling
description: Assisting students through personal support including coaching, mentoring and counseling focused on non-academic issues.

name: Career Services
description: Assisting students with career planning, resume development, interviewing skills, job searches and partnering with potential employers.

name: Financial Aid
description: Assisting students with loan counseling, financial literacy, and obtaining monetary support for the cost of attending college from sources other than the students and their families including scholarships, grants, loans and work-study programs

name: Registrar / Student Records
description: Assisting students with requests related to their academic records including transcripts, grades, appeals and verification of enrollment and progress toward receipt of degrees or certificates.

name: Tutoring
description: Formally providing supplemental academic assistance in support of regular coursework.

name: Testing Services
description: Administering or proctoring placement, proficiency, out of classroom, make-up, certification and standardized tests.

name: Recruitment
description: Building awareness among current and potential students through direct communication about activities leading up to admission to the institution or a particular program.

name: Co-curricular Activities
description: Supporting student engagement activities that promote social interaction, leadership, healthy recreation, self-discipline and self-confidence. Examples include student government, clubs, and intramural sports.

name: Instructional Technology Support
description: Providing instructional technology infrastructure and services to faculty and students. For example in-class technical assistance, training on how to use the learning management system and other new classroom technologies.

name: Library Services
description: Providing support and access to information resources in printed and electronic formats to support academic activities.

name: Experiential Education
description: Supporting  activities around service learning, clinical experience and internships
